Trade/Device Name(s): SPOTCHECK Neonatal GALT Microplate Reagent Kit
Regulation Name(s): Colorimeter, photometer, spectrophotometer for clinical use
Specimen Type(s): Whole blood (dried blood spot on filter paper)
Specimen Container(s): Standardized filter paper blood spot collection card
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for Astoria-Pacific SPOTCHECK Neonatal GALT Microplate Reagent Kit and SPOTCHECK Pro for quantitation of GALT enzyme activity in neonatal dried blood spots as an aid in screening for galactosemia
Indications for Use Summary: Quantitative determination of galactose-1-phosphate uridyl transferase activity in whole blood dried blood spots as an aid in neonatal screening for galactosemia using a microplate absorbance reader; SPOTCHECK Pro automates sample processing for in vitro diagnostic assays
